page.title: 01Redruth and environment
page.content: Redruth is a town roughly in the centre of the county of Cornwall. {Lanner and Carnkie}are two villages equal distance from the town, Lanner 1\ miles to the East and Carnkie to the South. {Redruth}was the centre of the tin mining industry in the last century and the tin ore was sent to ports at {Truro and Falmouth}for shipment.The tin industry has now declined except for a few mines which are still producing and the whole area around the town is marked with abandoned mine shafts and spoil tips.The old mines are characterised by tall chimneys built from local stone and adjacent engine houses. These housed the steam engines which provided the power for the mine. The land is now largely used for rough grazing for cattle.
